msgSnippet: Hi Chris, we are using JUnit also in our project Dyn 5.x based. I think it would be great to exchange our xperience about it. Now we have 2 king of test cases:

From: "Giuseppe Galli" <ggalli@...>

Hi Chris,
we are using JUnit also in our project Dyn 5.x based.
I think it would be great to exchange our xperience about it.
Now we have 2 king of test cases:
RuntimeTestCases and TestCases (static ones) .
The runtime test can be run only when the nucleus is running while the other
can be run at compile time and without the nucleus running.
In this moment we are facing to the task to develop (Runtime)TestCases for
the pipeline processes via the Pipeline Manager, the next step well be to
define some kind of framework to test the http stuff (cactus seems good also
to me). For the moment the guys have found a JUnit Extension developed by
ATG people for testing handlers behaviour but don't know how exactly it
works :-(
HTH
Pino


----- Original Message -----
From: <cmelinn@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 12, 2001 6:57 PM
Subject: [junit] JUnit & ATG Dynamo


> Could anyone provide information on using JUnit to test ATG Dynamo?
> It seems that Cactus might be a good solution, but I was hoping
> someone might have experience in integrating them before.  Any help
> would be greatly appreciated.
>
> Thanks,
> Chris
